body: @himanshug @cheddar hey guys just wondering what the status of this is
@anwenxu did you get a chance to see my last comment?
I am closing this PR as it seems like it has been addressed by #1506.

I think it is fine to merge this fix and make a note of it in the forums as well as documenting it. I dont know of any installation that actually overrides this configs, but it may be good to ask

LGTM (when travis is successful)
will reopen to force a new build

I'll squash if he has no more comments.

@fjy  I have 1 TODO @ https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/1521/files#diff-d19c7676e29a15ee2e34062c8e4ee6eaR947 which I'm hoping to resolve today. Also I need more testing of Remote Task Runner when MM is offline to make sure it doesn't fail the task. I haven't put a version # on this PR and I still put the Discussion tag to try and help globally communicate it's status.
I also haven't figured out a good solution for https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/1521#discussion_r34608966 yet
@nishantmonu51 @fjy  please merge if there are no further comments. thanks.

Squashed! Ready for merge at your leisure.

Broad comment: it looks like the commit metadata is actually attached to a set of persisted files, not just one persisted file. So does it really make sense to store the metadata in each persisted file?

It seems simpler/better to store a single file per datasource with metadata + the list of persisted files it applies to. You'd update that after writing out persisted files. If you wrote out only some of the persisted files, but not all of them, and then crashed, the next bootstrap would throw away persisted files that aren't present in the single metadata file.

It seems like the offset tracking here would lose its place if for some reason no new data was ingested for a while and then the task was restarted. All the old segments would be handed off and deleted, and then there'd be nothing to bootstrap from. Is that right? Is that bad?
@fjy Hi Fangjin, Just let you know I've filled out the CLA.
@mvfast Awesome! thanks :)

https://groups.google.com/forum/#!searchin/druid-development/credit/druid-development/1Zs3Vd9LHCQ/cadqT73UeVcJ
A few minor comments, the biggest being parameterizing with classes and not using String checks. If that is fixed, I am :+1:

@himanshug did we ever do some performance testing to get a sense of how much speed improvements we can get for things that aggregate well, and how much impact it may have on things that don't aggregate well? It would be useful to know at which point it makes sense to start using the combiner or not.
@himanshug #1472 is merged

@xvrl not yet, but, will do that.
Yeah, got you. mvn install is needed first, then package and run the sample. Thanks.

That seems reasonable- so basically you're advising the overlord that you will want a lock in the future (acquire_lock), then actually asking for the lock (upgrade_lock_to_superpower; which will succeed if nobody else with a higher priority has asked for one in the meantime), then releasing the lock.

I haven't had a chance to read this over too much, but from conversations with people I believe that this is sufficiently self-contained and low risk that it should be safe to move forward.  So, I'm :+1: on it.

After a discussion in the druid dev sync I'm shutting down this PR and starting one that implements a new task running paradigm (replacement for Remote Task Runner) as per https://groups.google.com/d/topic/druid-development/1I3CmxlOipM/discussion
@mistercrunch do you mind filing out our CLA (http://druid.io/community/cla.html)?
Done!
@fjy @gianm @cheddar @xvrl @drcrallen @nishantmonu51 this PR is ready for review [and merging]. I made some updates to PR title and description too.
@himanshug can we get some docs about using this? It'll be good to have a section in ingestion about reindexing data and delta ingestion
@fjy sure, I wanted to make the PR reviewable and write docs while review progressed.
@fjy updated the doc.

This has a very high potential to break other things. To me it would make more sense to have a time.zone in the query context and do a translation to the desired time.zone just in time on query return.
LGTM (after travis is successful)
@pjain1 these tests do not pass travis

@Hailei Have you taken a look at Period Granularity to return results in a different timezone?
http://druid.io/docs/latest/querying/granularities.html
@Hailei you may also be interested in http://druid.io/docs/latest/querying/dimensionspecs.html for grouping results based on different timezones, formats, and locales
@fjy let me check
@fjy Thanks. I have read those docs.But  If i use local time zone for segment, the output of  query will use the same time zone.don't need to translate, That is more appropriate for use.
I'd prefer not to have this in the examples as this is more for advanced use cases. I also want to remove the router at some point and have this logic live on the broker.

@Hailei That makes sense. We don't have a ton of experience with non-UTC timezones in production although this is something Druid should support better. There are a few open issues regarding this matter: https://github.com/druid-io/druidhttps://github.com/druid-io/druid/issues/1284/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+UTC

@cheddar @xvrl thoughts?
would it make sense to have that setting be http log level, and can be default to debug or something else that isn't on by default?

@drcrallen that would be ok as well, so basically we write our own Slf4jRequestLog (maybe just extend it) and do logger.degug(..) instead of logger.info(..) instead of having a config in ServerConfig?
another thing I thought (but dint do) was to put POST body also in the log . Jetty implementation doesn't log the request body.

interesting, it seems it became noop for standalone realtime nodes again in https://github.com/druid-io/druid/commit/7803ca0#diff-895b820da8031dc2a2cd28f14c90e6d2L68
@fjy was that a mistake or "announce" handler is not supposed to work for standalone realtime nodes?
good doc update, LGTM
@fjy it is passing now
@pjain1 were changes required? if not, the test is not deterministic and we should understand why

@fjy existing OverlordResourceTest in Druid master is deterministic. I added one test for getRunningTasks (the previous PR) and that was not deterministic. However, I have fixed it in this PR and all tests are deterministic now. In case you are wondering I have forced update the PR so the commit is lost (which was non deterministic).
:+1: with or without my comments addressed; none of them are critical

:+1:  I believe it's fine to have examples, we have examples for other experimental features. If anything, the router is one of the least experimental features we have, and is actually being used in production at scale, unlike others.

Merging the functionality into the broker sounds like a good idea, but until we have a concrete proposal I don't think we should hold up on making the docs better.

@fjy I added example config for middle manager as well (which I use time to time). 
Regarding router config, We are only putting router config in the code and not putting it in the documentation so it is still not so visible I guess.
okay, then I'm :+1:
@himanshug : I was thinking just use our normal logging implementation, then if you're needing http debug logs you can enable debug logs in your log4j2.xml for only that class.

@himanshug @rasahner  The chat handler was initially set to noop by default to simplify configs but I quickly realized that was a mistake. I'm cool with the default being announce. I'm also cool with removing noop chat handlers entirely and not even having a config.
Came up as a result of https://groups.google.com/d/msg/druid-user/ZTMTbm4c30c/4HoK6WTjMIIJ
Probably don't want to remove them completely, but restricting them to Test scope would be ok.

@fjy @drcrallen I would say keep them for now, let us just update RealtimeModule also to default to announce, and remove the setting from the docs (as is already done in this PR).
@rasahner can you please update RealtimeModule.java so that standalone realtime nodes also default to "announce" ?
close/reopen to rebuild
